summary: group A rotaviruses (RVA) are the main cause of neonatal calve diarrhea (NCD) in Morocco. isolated RVA strains from NCD clinical samples are a first step toward vaccine development. the isolation process constitutes a first step toward vaccine development. analysis sequencing revealed field isolates were of G6 P[5] serotype and isolates from the dairy NCD samples were of G10 P[14] serotype. this is the first study in Morocco which reports the circulation of G10P[14] in the field.
